page.title: 11LOCAL NEWS
page.content: Tenants in the Rivers area of Foxbar are fighting for safe play areas for their children. They are holding a meeting at the end of June in St Paul's Primary School in Foxbar and councillor Olga Clayton, convener of the district council Arts and Leisure Committee, and Mr Ian McAdam, director of Leisure and Recreation, have been invited to attend. The tenants are arguing that the small park in the area is ill-equipped and dangerous because the swings and the roundabout are built on concrete. One of the tenants who spoke to us about the situation described the play facilities for the children of Foxbar as 'a disgrace'. Other news is that Andrew McGeoch of St Aelreds H.S. has won a prize in Wm. Grants and Sons painting competition. Paintings on display at Paisley Museum
